definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: On this point, Liu Liguo's work expresses a kind of fatalism.
sentences.chinese: 就這一點說，劉力國的作品最終表達的是一種宿命。

sentences.english: Separation, like a field, always slip out of fate.
sentences.chinese: 分離，就像一場，永遠躲不了的宿命。

sentences.english: The result of a Jurassic Chrysanthemum, will be our destiny do.
sentences.chinese: 一侏菊花的結果，會成爲我們之間的宿命嗎。

sentences.english: Rock climbers and sports car drivers must be fatalist.
sentences.chinese: 攀巖運動汽車司機必須是宿命論者。

sentences.english: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone.
sentences.chinese: 愛是我們真正的宿命，形隻影單遍尋不到人生的意義。

sentences.english: Fatalism is an excuse of the weak-willed.
sentences.chinese: 宿命論是那些缺乏意志力的弱者的藉口。

sentences.english: My fate vacillates aimlessly and finally runs its course.
sentences.chinese: 我宿命的在流浪之途彷徨，最後消失。

sentences.english: He was a believer in dualism for both fatalism and causality.
sentences.chinese: 他是因果與宿命的二元論者。

sentences.english: This writing technique transcends the concept of the fatalism of historiography that "all history is a contemporary one".
sentences.chinese: 由此突破了“一切歷史都是當代史”的史學宿命。

sentences.english: Would you accept the concept of predestination ?
sentences.chinese: 你可以接受宿命的概念嗎？

sentences.english: Maybe it's from the Bible, I think, because Lincoln is a fatalist .
sentences.chinese: 林肯是個宿命論者，我猜是出自《聖經》。
宿命論是納齊恩斯基的唯一寄託。

sentences.english: Some may see this as fatalistic thinking.
sentences.chinese: 有人可能會將這看成一種宿命型思維。

sentences.english: The fate is waits for the matchmaker?

definition: variant of 輪迴|轮回[lun2 hui2]
in the unseen world of spirits/mysteriously and inexorably
to foreordain/to be bound to/to be destined to/to be doomed to/inevitably
the course of one's life/one's fate
constant (math.)/quota/fixed number (e.g. of places on a bus)/fixed quantity (e.g. load of truck)/destiny
